TopicTitle: KSP Interstellar Extended Continued Development Thread

Articles.Content:
43 minutes ago, Eleusis La Arwall said:

I'm currently working on a new model for the Thermal Launch Nozzle to get myself familiar with engines. Here is the current state:

My knowledge about rocket nozzles is rather limited and I hope for some feedback on how realistic my approach is for a launch-nozzle.

On another topic: Is someone currently working on a model for the thermal electric generator or the charged particle electric generator?

The nozzle seems very good. Usually small nozzles are used for lifters and larger ones for the vacuum of space. Then there are ones like the SSME (Space Shuttle Main Engines) that were in the middle, to be used both in atmo and space, but they provide very low thrust at sea level.

18 hours ago, Eleusis La Arwall said:

On another topic: Is someone currently working on a model for the thermal electric generator or the charged particle electric generator?

I actually just discussed a new thermal generator mesh with @FreeThinker but, your a whole lot better at this than I am, so if you want to, feel free. Your style also matches KSP much better than mine.

Edited August 29, 2017 by SpaceMouse
Fixed abundance  universal mining

On 29.8.2017 at 1:43 AM, Nansuchao said:

The nozzle seems very good. Usually small nozzles are used for lifters and larger ones for the vacuum of space. Then there are ones like the SSME (Space Shuttle Main Engines) that were in the middle, to be used both in atmo and space, but they provide very low thrust at sea level.

Thank you for the input! The engine should work in atmo and vacuum like the SSME, so the shape and size will remain unchanged. Model is almost finished:

19 hours ago, SpaceMouse said:

I actually just discussed a new thermal generator mesh with @FreeThinker but, your a whole lot better at this than I am, so if you want to, feel free. Your style also matches KSP much better than mine.

I see, it was just bothering me that the generators have no smooth transition to attached parts and don't use 24 sided cylinders. If you already started to work on a model I don't wanna take it away. Otherwise I'll thankfully take your offer.

The power rating of the tri-alpha fusion reactor needs to be revised.

It can never reach the max. power it is rated with. The maximum power thats displayed in the editor description would only be achievable with a fuel mode that has a NormalisedReactionRate of 1, and none of the aneutronic fusion modes available on the tri alpha have that. 
 

Edited August 30, 2017 by Hacki

3 hours ago, Eleusis La Arwall said:

I see, it was just bothering me that the generators have no smooth transition to attached parts and don't use 24 sided cylinders. If you already started to work on a model I don't wanna take it away. Otherwise I'll thankfully take your offer.

I've kinda grown used to the generator going from round to square-ish. I haven't started a model yet but, I DO want to re-do my fission reactor and was going to reuse some of the components.

I have uploaded a beta 1.15.1.1 which can be downloaded from here

* Fixed Blanked Rectenna wavelength switching

* Balance: Improved efficiency Thermal Power Generators

* Balance: increased mass Deplorable Phased Array

Hi! Love the mod, just one thing: I made a stock Mun probe with this mod installed, and I had some provotoloic (however you pronounce that LOL) panels on it. when I was in Mun orbit, I ran out of electricity. Apparently, the panels were in direct sunlight, but there was no power flow. I know it was this mod since I know this changes things with solar panels. Please help!

1 hour ago, The_TwistedTaco said:

Hi! Love the mod, just one thing: I made a stock Mun probe with this mod installed, and I had some provotoloic (however you pronounce that LOL) panels on it. when I was in Mun orbit, I ran out of electricity. Apparently, the panels were in direct sunlight, but there was no power flow. I know it was this mod since I know this changes things with solar panels. Please help!

That seems unlikely. KSPIE is not the only mod that influence solar power you know, several other mods do it as well, like Kebalism

Edited September 3, 2017 by FreeThinker

26 minutes ago, FreeThinker said:

That seems unlikely. KSPIE is not the only mod that influence solar power you know, several other mods do it as well, like Kebalism

oh, well i did install some other mods along with this. I can't quite remember all of them, but this was the only one i remember that changed solar power. well, could it have been KSPIE? do i need that Thermal electric generator thing?

13 hours ago, The_TwistedTaco said:

oh, well i did install some other mods along with this. I can't quite remember all of them, but this was the only one i remember that changed solar power. well, could it have been KSPIE? do i need that Thermal electric generator thing?

kopernicos is a problem source too
did you try F5-F9?

well, I do have kopernicus installed, so i can run extrasolar. i looked in kopernicus's files and found something that said it replaced the stock solar panels with kopernicus's panels. so is that the problem? it said i can turn it off, but i couldn't understand it.
